intro: Microstylis wariana var. oreogena, commonly known as the Sierra microstylis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at higher elevations, often in mountainous regions. Its leaves are narrow and aromatic, and it produces small white or yellowish flowers. This variety is noted for its ecological importance in supporting local pollinators and its adaptability to harsh alpine environments.
